fictionBooks.title: The Vanishing Half
fictionBooks.author: Brit Bennett
fictionBooks.synopsis: The lives of twin sisters who run away from a Southern black community at age 16 diverge as one returns and the other takes on a different racial identity but their fates intertwine.

fictionBooks.title: The Guest List
fictionBooks.author: Lucy Foley
fictionBooks.synopsis: A wedding between a TV star and a magazine publisher on an island off the coast of Ireland turns deadly.

fictionBooks.title: Where The Crawdads Sing
fictionBooks.author: Delia Owens
fictionBooks.synopsis: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.

fictionBooks.title: The Lies That Bind
fictionBooks.author: Emily Giffin
fictionBooks.synopsis: When the new man in her life disappears on 9/11, the budding reporter Cecily Gardner questions what she knew about him.

fictionBooks.title: Hideaway
fictionBooks.author: Nora Roberts
fictionBooks.synopsis: A child star escapes her abductors, gathers herself in western Ireland and returns to Hollywood.

nonfictionBooks.title: White Fragility
nonfictionBooks.author: Robin DiAngelo
nonfictionBooks.synopsis: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people and how this inhibits cross-racial dialogue.

nonfictionBooks.title: So You Want To Talk About Race
nonfictionBooks.author: Ijeoma Oluo
nonfictionBooks.synopsis: A look at the contemporary racial landscape of the United States.

nonfictionBooks.title: How To Be An Antiracist
nonfictionBooks.author: Ibram X Kendi
nonfictionBooks.synopsis: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.

nonfictionBooks.title: Me And White Supremacy
nonfictionBooks.author: Layla F Saad
nonfictionBooks.synopsis: Winner of the 2016 National Book Award for nonfiction. A look at anti-black racist ideas and their effect on the course of American history.

nonfictionBooks.title: The New Jim Crow
nonfictionBooks.author: Michelle Alexander
nonfictionBooks.synopsis: The Fox News Sunday anchor gives an account of the key people involved in and events leading up to Americaâ€™s attack on Hiroshima in 1945.

nonfictionBooks.title: Why Are All Black Kids Sitting Together In The Cafeteria?
nonfictionBooks.author: Beverly Tatum
